p: Leishmania ( Viannia) panamensis is an important causal agent of cutaneous leishmaniasis (CL) in Central and South America [ 2] and approximately 0.7-1.2 million cases occur annually. Different forms of leishmaniasis demand expensive treatments, the currently used medicines pentavalent antimonials, pentamidine isethionate, and miltefosine show high toxicity; therefore, they induce severe side effects. Thus, there is an urgency to develop new drugs to treat CL [ 3].
